text: we know that being strategic is an
essential leadership practice don't we
but it can be really hard to do my name
is David lancefield I'm a seite adviser
and coach and in my recent hbr article I
set out some practical ways to do this
first is to focus on the critical
actions decisions discussions the
difficult conversations negotiations
that have a disproportionate impact on
the strategy the second is to focus on
the biggest problem in each of those
moments what do you need to overcome to
make progress or in a reframe what
opportun you need to pursue then
consider the choices you have in each of
those moments that's where to focus what
to do how to show up what impact to have
and then consider what skills do you
need to master in each of those moments
it could be how to negotiate effectively
how to tackle conflicts how do you
enhance those skills whether it's
learning from an inspiring colleague
taking advice from a mentor or using
technology throughout all of this you'll
have to tackle potential conflicts and
tensions between what you want to
consider and do with other the team and
and also the organization think about a
reframe how do you turn what may be
considered an operational task to
something more Innovative and growing
which you might consider more attractive
from your own personal perspective
supporting all of this is marshalling
the resources you need to do your best
work whether it's the mental physical
relational or environmental good food
exercise sleep good colleagues around
you and finding a good place to work it
is possible to overcome these obstacles
if you consider and use strategy every
single day so where will you start
